intro: Gymnanthes ligustrina, commonly known as the black beauty or black star, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking, dark purple to black berries. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture. The fruit is fleshy and contains a single seed, making it an important food source for various wildlife species.
